password_hashing.name: Argon2
password_hashing.desc: Winner of Password Hashing Competition, industry standard

variants.name: Argon2id
variants.desc: Hybrid mode, recommended for password hashing

cryptographic_hashing.name: SHA-2
cryptographic_hashing.desc: NIST standard, most widely deployed hash family

cryptographic_hashing.name: SHA-3
cryptographic_hashing.desc: Keccak-based NIST standard, different construction from SHA-2

variants.name: BLAKE2s
variants.desc: Optimized for 8-32 bit platforms, up to 256-bit

variants.name: Keccak-256
variants.desc: Used in Ethereum, different from SHA3-256

post_quantum_cryptography.name: CRYSTALS-Kyber
post_quantum_cryptography.desc: Lattice-based key encapsulation, NIST PQC winner

experimental_hashing.name: Kangaroo Twelve
experimental_hashing.desc: Fast variant of Keccak with reduced rounds

experimental_hashing.name: Ascon
experimental_hashing.desc: Lightweight crypto winner, AEAD and hash

experimental_proof_of_work.name: RandomHash
experimental_proof_of_work.desc: Dynamic algorithm selection based on block hash

experimental_authenticated_encryption.name: AEGIS
experimental_authenticated_encryption.desc: AES-based AEAD, extremely fast with AES-NI

classification.stable: Production-ready, standardized, or proven through extensive deployment
classification.under_evaluation: Experimental, research-stage, competition finalists, or emerging standards

notes: Post-quantum algorithms are transitioning to standardization (NIST selections)
Many 'under evaluation' PoW algorithms are actually in production on smaller chains
CAESAR and eSTREAM competition results still relevant for research
Lightweight crypto (Ascon) gaining traction for IoT applications
